syncNodes.name: Node Name
syncNodes.remarkHelp: Free-form note; connection address is reported by the agent.
syncNodes.addressHelp: Legacy field; agent address is reported automatically.
syncNodes.tokenCreateHelp: Copy this token to your agent environment variables.
syncNodes.empty: No nodes yet. Click "Add Node" to create one.

tooltips.resetPairing: Reset pairing (clear mTLS fingerprint, wait for agent reconnect)

syncNodes.mtlsUnpaired: mTLS fingerprint: unpaired (waiting for first agent connection)

snack.resetSuccess: Pairing reset; waiting for agent reconnect

syncTasks.title: Task Details - {{name}}
syncTasks.recentHint: Showing the latest {{count}} tasks; use paging for older records.
syncTasks.clearConfirm: Clear task records for {{scope}}? (Defaults to clearing success/failed)
syncTasks.clearFailed: Clear failed (admin permission or server error)

hints.eacces: Possible cause: target path is not writable or filesystem is read-only (chown/chmod or change targetPath).
hints.enoent: Possible cause: target path does not exist (check targetPath or parent permissions).
hints.enospc: Possible cause: disk is full (free up space).
hints.proto: Possible cause: connection/protocol error (check primary node and agent versions).

syncProjects.empty: No synced projects (enable sync in Versions).

sync.watchHelp: Watches file system events and triggers sync automatically.
sync.ignoreHelp: Rules without '/' match any depth; ** is supported.
sync.ignoreFileHelp: Path is relative to the primary node project root; # and ! are supported.
sync.disabledHint: Sync is disabled. Enable it to configure ignore rules and nodes.

permissions.symlinkHint: Note: creating symlinks on Windows may require admin or developer mode.
permissions.disabledHint: Sync is disabled. Enable it to configure permissions and symlink policy.

advanced.overlayEnable: Enable overlay delta index (high performance; requires baseline scan)
advanced.deltaMaxFiles: Delta index max files (fallback to full scan when exceeded)
advanced.overlayFullScanEvery: Overlay baseline full scan: force every N tasks (optional)
advanced.overlayFullScanEveryHelp: For correction: missing events or damaged files on agents.
advanced.overlayFullScanInterval: Overlay baseline full scan: max interval (duration, optional)
advanced.disabledHint: Sync is disabled. Enable it to configure delta index and baseline scans.

nodes.title: Sync nodes
nodes.empty: No nodes available. Create one in Node Manager first.
nodes.strategyHelp: mirror: align source and delete extras; overlay: add/overwrite only.
nodes.extraIgnoreHelp: Merged with project rules in order (supports ! negate).

mirror.title: Mirror optimizations (optional)
mirror.fullscanEvery: Force full scan delete every N tasks (optional)

ignoreHelp.order: Rules match in order; the last match wins.
ignoreHelp.anyDepth: Rules without / match any depth (same as **/pattern).

version.title: Version Management
version.confirmDeleteText: Are you sure you want to delete project "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.
version.confirmInitGitText: Are you sure you want to initialize Git repository for project "{{name}}"?
version.setRemoteText: Set remote repository URL for project {{name}}:
version.projectPathPlaceholder: Absolute path of the project on server
version.remoteUrlPlaceholder: Enter complete Git remote repository URL
version.confirmSwitchBranchText: Are you sure you want to switch to branch "{{name}}"?
version.forceSwitchWarning: Warning: forcing the switch permanently discards uncommitted local changes
version.confirmDeleteBranchText: Delete branch "{{name}}"? This cannot be undone.
version.filterTagPlaceholder: Enter tag prefix, e.g. v0.1 or v1.0
version.confirmSwitchTagText: Switch to tag "{{name}}"? This will put the project into detached HEAD state.
version.confirmDeleteTagText: Delete tag "{{name}}"? Local and remote tags will be removed.

env.templatePlaceholder: Choose a template to quickly populate the editor
env.editorPlaceholderEnv:
# Standard ENV format
KEY=value
ANOTHER_KEY=another_value

# Use the templates above to get started
env.editorPlaceholderToml:
# TOML format
[section]
key = "value"

# Use the templates above to get started
env.templateHint: Tip: choose a template above to start faster
env.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the environment file?
env.formatHint: Affects highlighting/formatting only; file name stays the same
env.zeroWidthConfirmRemoveBeforeSave: Zero-width characters detected ({{count}}). Click OK to remove them before saving, or Cancel to save as-is.

githook.title: GitHook Configuration
githook.enableDescription: When enabled, Git repository webhooks will automatically trigger code pull and deployment
githook.branchModeDescription: Trigger deployment when specified branch has new commits
githook.tagModeDescription: Trigger deployment when new tags are created
githook.anyBranch: Any branch (switch to whichever branch triggers the webhook)
githook.anyBranchDescription: Any branch mode: automatically switch to the corresponding branch and pull latest code when webhook is triggered
githook.specificBranchDescription: Specific branch mode: only webhooks from {{branch}} branch will trigger deployment
githook.webhookPasswordDescription: When set, webhook requests must include this password to trigger deployment. Use the buttons on the right to generate random password or copy current password.
githook.webhookUrlDescription: Please configure this URL in your Git repository's webhook settings
githook.forceSyncDescription: When enabled, GitHook will force reset local changes and sync with remote code

hook.title: Hook Management
hook.name: Name
hook.confirmDeleteText: Are you sure you want to delete hook "{{name}}"?
hook.addDialogDescription: Create basic webhook info. After creation, configure parameter passing, trigger rules, and response settings.
hook.editBasicDescription: Update basic webhook settings including command, working directory, and response message.

fields.idHelper: Unique identifier for the webhook and URL path
fields.executeCommandHelper: Command or script path to run when the webhook is triggered
fields.workingDirectoryHelper: Working directory for executing the command; leave empty to use current directory
fields.responseMessageHelper: Message returned when webhook executes successfully

validation.idPattern: Hook ID can only contain letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores

parameters.description: Configure how to pass webhook request data to the command. Arguments are passed in order; environment variables are set in the command environment.
parameters.commandArgumentsHelp: Arguments are passed to the command in order
parameters.environmentVariablesHelp: Environment variables are set in the command environment

response.description: Configure webhook HTTP response settings, including allowed methods, headers, and output.
response.methodsHint: Select allowed HTTP methods. At least one method is required.
response.includeOutputHint: When enabled, stdout will be included in the HTTP response
response.includeErrorOutput: Include error output when command fails
response.includeErrorOutputHint: When enabled, error output is included in the HTTP response

triggers.builderDescription: Build trigger rules with the visual editor. Supports multiple match types and logic combinations (AND/OR/NOT). If no rules are added, all requests will execute the command.
triggers.emptyDescription: Click a button below to start adding trigger rules
triggers.mismatchStatusCode: HTTP status code when trigger rules do not match
triggers.mismatchStatusCodeHelp: Returned when the request doesn't match trigger rules (recommended 400-499)

value.label: Exact match
value.description: Parameter value must equal the specified value

ipWhitelist.label: IP allowlist
ipWhitelist.description: Check if request IP is allowed

not.label: NOT
not.description: Match when child rule does not match

script.saveWarningUpdateCommandFailed: Script saved, but failed to update execute command. Update it manually.
script.commandSectionDescription: Configure the command or executable path to run, including arguments and options
script.scriptNameHelper: No file extension needed; it will be added automatically
script.scriptDirectoryHelper: Script file will be saved in this directory
script.templateFillHint: Selecting a template will populate the editor
script.editorPlaceholderNew:
# {{format}} script content

# Use the template above to get started
script.templateQuickHint: üí° Tip: choose a template above to start faster

gitDeploy.comment5: Install dependencies (choose based on project type)
gitDeploy.comment7: Restart services (choose based on actual situation)

jsWebhook.comment2: Get webhook data from environment variables

pySimple.comment2: Get webhook info from environment variables

snack.updateResponseFailed: Failed to update hook response settings
snack.updateResponseFailedWithError: Failed to update hook response settings: {{error}}
